metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3156 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Sudo before 1.9.5p2 contains an off-by-one error that can result in a heap-based buffer overflow, which allows privilege escalation to root via "sudoedit -s" and a command-line argument that ends with a single backslash character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4
sudo-ldap - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sudo package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4').
